Question: explanation for Common Iterator mistake: :import java.io.*;import javax.swing.JOptionPane;import java.util.*;public class lesson {     static void printAll(ArrayList<String> names, int len)      {         Iterator it = names.iterator();         while( it.hasNext() )         {         if( ((String)it.next()).length() == len)         System.out.println( it.next() );         }      }    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {        ArrayList<String> names = new ArrayList<String>();        names.add("Jan");        names.add("Ivan");        names.add("Tom");        names.add("George");        printAll(names,3);    }}why is the output Ivan, George, shouldn't it print only names with length 3 (which are Jan and Tom)?
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
